--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> BIC: How big is Redhot?
> 

    OOC: He's as large as the game max hight will go..I believe it's 
16 feet. 


> Beachcomber turned suddenly, noticed Redhot again. He positioned 
himself
> under Redhot's arm, to support him. He began to speak calmly, "No, 
it's
> not my right to judge you worthy of being saved." he said, although 
a
> bit disturbed by the voice, he knew he had heard it before. "I just 
do
> what I feel is right, and letting anyone die isnt." he then thought
> reflectivly. <Would Cliffjumper have done the same, or has he gone 
to
> far from the Autobots path as well as the Maximals. Firedrill was 
still
> young, and could be taught. They had to remember, war or no war, 
life is
> precious. He hoped he was wrong.> Beachcomber hoped Redhot was 
strong
> enough. "Do you have anyplace to go?" he asked, not sure what the 
next
> course of actions was. He was now an outcast, and wondered what 
happened
> to the other three he was with.
> 

::REDHOT::

    His smile softened. He tried to regain his legs and he trembled 
under the effort. 
    "You ...sound very much... l...like an Autobot." he said, humor
in 
his voice. "You... r...emind... me of the... ones I left at... 
h...ome."
    Confident that he could continue standing, he tested his legs by 
walking in a small circle around the Autobot. He turned to face 
Beachcomber and gave him his characteristic Michevious grin. When he 
got that look you knew he had something in mind.
    "Mind..you..some of them have..n..no sense of humor." he
chuckled. 
"I love..pran..pranks." His expression looked pained for a momment.
It was obvious he was homesick. "Until...I recover completely....I 
..can..not go..h...home." he said, depressed. "I..I have..no..no
place to go." 
    A pause lapsed before he spoke again. 
    "My name is Redhot."


Northlight
Domnijoe Productions
